title: Here’s why you’ll likely see long lines at Anna’s Taqueria locations today
author: John Waller
bullets: Anna's Taqueria celebrates 30 years by offering $3.50 super burritos on September 10, 2025.
The promotion recalls 1995 prices and is available in-store and online, with potential extra costs for some toppings.
Anna's Taqueria started on Beacon Street in Brookline and has expanded to 10 locations, including Woburn and Natick.

title: Patriots rookie TreVeyon Henderson announces engagement
author: John Waller
bullets: Patriots rookie running back TreVeyon Henderson announced his engagement on Instagram with a photo of his fiancée.
Henderson, a former Ohio State player, shared a Bible verse in the caption of his engagement post.
Details about Henderson's fiancée were not disclosed, as he typically focuses on football and faith on social media.

title: Red Sox rookie Connelly Early discussed his dominant MLB debut
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox rookie Connelly Early made a standout MLB debut, pitching five scoreless innings with 11 strikeouts.
Early tied a team record for rookie debuts, contributing to Boston's 6-0 victory over the Athletics.
Despite limited hype, Early impressed with his poise and performance, aided by catcher Carlos Narváez's preparation.

title: One injured in Boston scaffolding collapse
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A construction worker was injured when scaffolding collapsed on the third floor of a building in Boston's South End.
The worker, placed on a stretcher and extricated by firefighters, was transported to a local hospital for concussion protocol.
The Occupational Safety and Health Administration and local building inspector are investigating the cause of the scaffolding collapse.

title: Market Basket board votes to remove Arthur T. Demoulas
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Arthur T. Demoulas removed as Market Basket CEO after unanimous board vote citing corporate tensions.
Board accused Demoulas of retaliation plans and refused basic corporate oversight participation.
Demoulas's ouster follows a failed mediation with his sisters, who hold 61% company control.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Sept. 10)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Abington home sales include a 4-bedroom Colonial at 165 Oak St. for $622,500 and a 3-bedroom Cape Cod at 188 Oak St. for $580,000.
In Acton, a 2-bedroom Condo Town House at 123 Skyline Drive sold for $860,000, while 239 Arlington St. fetched $849,000 for a 3-bedroom house.
Amesbury's 5 Wingate St., a 4-bedroom Colonial, sold for $850,000, and a newer 3-bedroom Condo Town House at Bailey Pond Lane sold for $1,049,000.

title: Here’s who will be on the ballot in November’s 2025 City Council election
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Boston's preliminary election narrowed candidates for the November 4, 2025, City Council general elections.
Ruthzee Louijeune leads in the at-large city councilor race with 17.65% of the vote, followed closely by Julia Mejia.
Incumbent Gabriela Coletta Zapata secures a strong win in District 1, receiving 76.96% of the preliminary votes.

title: Mayoral preliminary: Wu maintains huge lead over Kraft as both advance to November election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu leads mayoral race, advancing to November election with 45-point lead over Josh Kraft.
Preliminary election saw nearly 18% voter turnout, with over 75,000 ballots cast by 6 p.m.
Robert Cappucci and Domingos DaRosa eliminated from the race, leaving Wu and Kraft as finalists.

title: What to know about the viral surrogacy lawsuit
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Cindy Bi, a venture capitalist, sued surrogate Rebecca Smith alleging negligent miscarriage after their relationship turned hostile.
Smith faced harassment from Bi, including job interference and social media smears, leading her to move and change jobs.
The surrogacy industry is rapidly expanding, but regulatory measures are struggling to keep pace with industry growth and related disputes.

title: A healthy Hampus Lindholm could change Bruins’ fortunes in several areas
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returns healthy for Bruins training camp, aiming to impact defense and power play.
Lindholm missed 65 games last season due to a fractured patella; he looks to improve Boston's power play.
The Bruins are optimistic about the season with Lindholm's return and other injured players coming back.
